pong

Class Pong

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AbstractComponent
      • core.AbstractProblem
        • core.AbstractMultiProblem
          • pong.Pong

  • public class Pong
extends AbstractMultiProblem
    Represents two-dimensional tennis game and belongs to arcade genre. This implementation includes multiple players which should be organized using self-organizing principles. More information about this game http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pong
    Author:
    Sergii Zhevzhyk

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateFitness

        public java.util.List<AbstractMultiProblem.RepresentationWithScore> evaluateFitness(AbstractRepresentation[] candidates)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMultiProblem
        Returns the fitness of the given representations. The returned list contains the representations with their achieved scores. A higher score usually means a better ranking.
        However, the order of the candidates matters the most for ranking, the scores are secondary.
        Specified by:
        evaluateFitness in class AbstractMultiProblem
        Parameters:
        candidates - Array of candidates to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        a list of evaluated candidates with decreasing fitness. That means better candidates have lower index.

      • replayWithVisualization

        public void replayWithVisualization(AbstractRepresentation[] candidates)
        Runs the simulation with graphical display
        Overrides:
        replayWithVisualization in class AbstractMultiProblem
        Parameters:
        candidates - Array of candidates whose replay has been requested.
